attributes.text:
A spinner is a control that allows you to adjust a numerical value, typically within an allowed range. An obvious example would be to specify the month of a year as a number in the range 1 – 12.

To do so, a spinner encompasses a field to display the current value (a textfield) and controls such as up and down buttons to change that value. The current value can also be changed by editing the display field directly, or using mouse wheel and cursor keys.

An optional {@link #numberFormat} property allows you to control the format of how a value can be entered and will be displayed.

A brief, but non-trivial example:

var s = new qx.ui.form.Spinner();
s.set({
  maximum: 3000,
  minimum: -3000
});
var nf = new qx.util.format.NumberFormat();
nf.setMaximumFractionDigits(2);
s.setNumberFormat(nf);

A spinner instance without any further properties specified in the constructor or a subsequent set command will appear with default values and behaviour.
Minimum value
Current value
Maximum value
The new value of the editable property
The former value of the editable property

Apply routine for the editable property.

It sets the textfield of the spinner to not read only.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property enabled.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyEnabled}.
The new value of the max property
The old value of the max property

Apply routine for the maximum property.

It sets the value of the spinner to the minimum of the current spinner value and the given max property value.
The new value of the min property
The old value of the min property

Apply routine for the minimum property.

It sets the value of the spinner to the maximum of the current spinner value and the given min property value.
The new value of the numberFormat property
The former value of the numberFormat property

Apply routine for the numberFormat property.

When setting a number format, the display of the value in the textfield will be changed immediately.
The new value of the spinner
The former value of the spinner

Apply routine for the value property.

It checks the min and max values, disables / enables the buttons and handles the wrap around.
The new value of the wrap property
The former value of the wrap property

Apply routine for the wrap property.

Enables all buttons if the wrapping is enabled.
The value being set

Check whether the value being applied is allowed.

If you override this to change the allowed type, you will also want to override {@link #_applyValue}, {@link #_applyMinimum}, {@link #_applyMaximum}, {@link #_countUp}, {@link #_countDown}, and {@link #_onTextChange} methods as those cater specifically to numeric values.
true if the value is allowed; false> otherwise.
Checks if the spinner is in page mode and counts either the single or page Step down.
Checks if the spinner is in page mode and counts either the single or page Step up.
Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.
The content padding target.
Returns the regular expression used as the text field’s filter
The filter RegExp.
locale change event
Callback method for the locale Manager’s “changeLocale” event.
number format change event
Callback method for the number format’s “changeNumberFormat” event.
keyDown event

Callback for “keyDown” event.

Controls the interval mode (“single” or “page”) and the interval increase by detecting “Up”/“Down” and “PageUp”/“PageDown” keys.

The corresponding button will be pressed.
keyUp event

Callback for “keyUp” event.

Detecting “Up”/“Down” and “PageUp”/“PageDown” keys.

Releases the button and disabled the page mode, if necessary.
mouseWheel event

Callback method for the “mouseWheel” event.

Increments or decrements the value of the spinner.
text change event or blur event
Callback method for the “change” event of the textfield.
Checks the min and max values, disables / enables the buttons and handles the wrap around.
